headline: 1 Way Tariffs Could Cripple GM for Investors
summary: The markets received good news when it was announced that President Donald Trump would pause reciprocal tariffs on most countries for 90 days and is opting to implement a base 10% tariff on most goods.  Worse yet, the automotive industry is expected to get slapped with an additional 25% tariff on automotive parts next month.  The problem for General Motors (NYSE: GM) investors is that this could force the company to change one thing it's done really well recently: buying back shares.
